review_title: Tragically incompetent leadership at Toronto campus
pros: - Salary - Central location - Hybrid working conditions - Potential to contribute to a new and growing campus - Opportunity to work with students (many international students) - Get to work with some skilled professionals with a genuine interest in supporting students and their success
cons: - Save a few exceptions, the senior leadership team is grossly incompetent (I.e., not doing the jobs they were hired to do, lack the knowledge, skills and experience to do their jobs and could care less about students) - Unprofessional behaviour and acts of incivility toward non-management staff regularly displayed by senior leaders  - Competent staff punished for producing results, incompetent staff praised for meager efforts - Nepotism is alive and well

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Vancouver, BC
pros: Have to manage position while attending school. Good pay. Interaction with students and professor.
cons: Sometimes there's lack of instruction but you should be asking questions about grading, etc. anyways.
